conclusion: Determine accelerations by analyzing the v-t graph.
Acceleration is the slope of the v-t graph.
Positive slope indicates positive acceleration, negative slope indicates negative acceleration.
For object A, slope is positive and decreasing from t=0 to t_p.
Object A's acceleration is positive but decreasing until t_p.
After t_p, slope for object A becomes negative.
Object A's acceleration becomes negative and increases in magnitude after t_p.
For object B, slope is positive and decreasing from t=0 to t_1.
Object B's acceleration is positive but decreasing throughout.
Object A's acceleration is first increasing (positive) and then decreasing (becomes negative).
Object B's acceleration is decreasing throughout the interval.
Accelerations of both objects are not first increasing and then decreasing in the same manner.
